meanings.definition: To straighten or unfold something that has been rolled up.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unrolled the scroll to read the ancient writing.
meanings.sent2: Please unroll the map so we can see the entire route.
meanings.sent3: As she tried to unroll the poster, it kept rolling back up like a mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: The story slowly unrolled before her like a never-ending carpet of words.
meanings.sent5: He unrolled the sleeping bag and laid it out under the stars.

meanings.definition: To reveal or display something that was previously hidden or concealed.
meanings.sent1: The magician unrolled the scroll to show the secret message written inside.
meanings.sent2: When she unrolled the treasure map, it revealed the location of the hidden chest.
meanings.sent3: The detective unrolled the blueprint and discovered a hidden room behind the wall.
meanings.sent4: The fog slowly unrolled to reveal a breathtaking view of the valley below.
meanings.sent5: With a dramatic flourish, he unrolled the banner to display the winning team's name.
